revised_title: Taxonomic and Morphological Analysis of Chydorus faviformis and Honeycombed Taxa in Other Continents
tldr: The author examines the North American Chydorus faviformis and other honeycombed taxa from different continents. They discover that these taxa are distinct species, with differences in morphology and geographical distribution. The study provides detailed descriptions of these species and challenges the concept of cosmopolitanism in taxonomy and evolution.
